The Road Up the Mountain: The Four Noble Truths of Buddhism
Mother Clare Watts

Saturday, November 15 • 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
Cost $35 (includes lunch)

The Buddhist approach to life’s suffering and to freedom from suffering can be applied to any spiritual path as it contains an essential truth. The truth that life contains suffering that is due to one’s attachments is a lesson that humans must learn over and over in varying degrees and layers. Detachment from the world and attachment to truth brings peace to the heart and mind. This seminar will explore the Four Noble Truths of Buddhism and how they can be applied to modern spiritual development. Join us for a trip up the mountain toward freedom.
